stories.text: What's a useful gift to give to a programmer? I am trying to think of something that they will either use daily, or increase their knowledge/productivity. Budget $100USD. I was thinking one-off/non-subscription high-quality paid utilities, e.g. diff tools such as Beyond Compare, HFS+ file system driver etc. I also considered courses/ebooks but generally I feel that, unless these are the highest quality, utilities will be more often used. Anyway, all suggestions welcome, regardless of targeted developer platform/domain.
stories.title: Ask HN: What's a Good Gift for Programmers?
Ham Radio SSB Transceiver Fits in Pocket

stories.text:
I am curious which tech stack would be in highest demand among small businesses?

I see a lot of posts about developers favorite tech stacks. I can go on github and see the trending or most stars for top projects.

But if you wanted to do some side work for small business, what tech stack is most used?
stories.title: Ask HN: Top tech stack for small businesses?
How to Learn to Code When You Have No Time and No Money (2018)
Drivers Playing Video Games? US Is Looking into Tesla Case
